answers.answer: There are no doctors on this board, male, only other people with diabetesThere are a couple things you don't mention. Do you test your blood sugar? And if so, what sorts of readings are you seeing first thing? You say you feel better after breakfast. How long do you wait to eat? If your blood sugar is low when you get up, you should be eating pretty soon. Also, when did you last see your doctor or get an A1C?You mention drinking. Alcohol lowers blood sugar, sometimes dramatically. If you are drinking even a moderate amount at night, your blood sugar might, in fact, be dipping too low overnight. Do some testing to see what's going on and try making some changes in food and alcohol and if there is no improvement, you might want to see your doctor.

Ok will try to post the latest readings , but when I checked last monthMorning fasting sugar was 140mgAlso sometimes once or twice a week I really get abundant energy so as to do 1 hr of continuos strenuous exercise at the gymRegarding alcohol I take it only during weekends but the tiredness exists throughout the weekJohn

Dumb question: You have diabetes, you're feeling crappy (enough to post on this board) and the last time you checked your blood sugar was last month? If you are diabetic, that is the first thing you should check, then look for other possibilities for how you feel. (It isn't ALWAYS diabetes!)140 is too high for a fasting sugar, btw.

When was your last doctor's visit? If you've been a diabetic for nine years and now have a fasting glucose of 140 mg/dl indicates you've been ignoring your diabetes and haven't paid attention to your doctor's instructions.Testing your glucose levels whenever, in your case last month, and doing "strenuous exercises at the gym" because you have 'abundant energy" only makes matters worse.Bottom line stop posting on forums and make an appointment to see your doctor today for you may have other issues going on; thyroid, pancreas, liver and/or kidney.

Thank you all for all the useful advice.Yes I had made an appointment with my doctor 6 months ago and did a complete checkup even including scan of abdomeneven the doctor was baffled and he wrote in his comments"cause for early morning asthenia to be investigated"So I back to square one and no one seems to know why I feel very tired  in the early morningsJohn

You might want to look at this web site on "Misdiagnosis of Underlying Causes of Asthenia" http://www.wrongdiagnosis.com/a/asthenia/underly.htmAnd, a referral visit to a Neurologist and a Hematologist may be in order.

question: Hello Doctor(s)I'm a male 39 yrs old and diagnosed with type II diabetes for the last 9 yearsMy medication includes Glynase 10mg in the morning with breakfastThe problem I'm having is thisUsually I feel very energetic in the morningsBut off late for the last 6 months or soWhen I wake up I feel very tired indeedand normally I used to walk 30 mins in the treadmill at my gym but nowadays my body screeches to a halt at the 10th minute itselfbut after breakfast and about noon Im ok and Im very brisk etc in officeI get a good nights sleepBUt this early morning tiredness is hampering my exercise routine a lotI drink only in the weekendsJohnThis discussion is related to/posts/show/669422.
title: Feeling very tired in the Mornings
